hero.title: Dimitri Bourreau
hero.subtitle: Passionate fullstack developer
hero.description: I share my knowledge, case studies and projects. Need guidance? I'll point you in the right direction.

topArticles.title: Featured articles
topArticles.article1: Hexagonal architecture in frontend: lessons learned
topArticles.article2: Next.js rewrite in 6 months: hexa arch, React Query, and the human side!
topArticles.article3: How I reduced loading times by 10x on a Next.js app

approach.title: What sets me apart
approach.hexagonal_desc: I apply hexagonal architecture principles on the frontend: ports, adapters, strict decoupling between UI and business logic.
approach.legacy_desc: I enjoy modernizing aging codebases. Progressive migration, zero regressions, measurable results.
approach.mentoring_desc: Supporting junior and senior developers is part of my daily work. Kind code reviews, pair programming, skill development.
approach.documentation_desc: I write clear and accessible technical documentation. ADRs, guides, onboarding: every decision is tracked and shared.

testimonials.title: Testimonials
testimonials.quote1: His openness to learning and discussion is remarkable. His intellectual curiosity and constant desire to improve make him a valuable asset to any team.
testimonials.quote2: Dimitri did remarkable work on an international project with diverse challenges. Always attentive and highly invested. We continued working together.
testimonials.quote3: Attentive and invested, Dimitri quickly integrated despite numerous challenges. His good humor and attention make him the ideal profile.
testimonials.quote4: Thanks to him, knowledge leveling within a team happens naturally. His skills go well beyond the functional minimum. I recommend Dimitri wholeheartedly.
testimonials.quote5: Great collaboration, smooth exchanges and attentive listening. I recommend.
testimonials.quote6: Dimitri is extremely motivated and competent, he seeks to get to the bottom of things. Several successful missions, a pleasure to work together.

flightRadar.milestone1_desc: I learn HTML, CSS and PHP on Site du Z√©ro in the school library
flightRadar.milestone2_desc: After leaving foster care, I take my first jobs to get off the streets
flightRadar.milestone3_desc: Flying to Tokyo, I fall in love with airplanes! üõ´
flightRadar.milestone4_desc: Without a diploma or money, I learn to fly in Bordeaux to become an airline pilot
flightRadar.milestone5_desc: Unfit to fly due to my eyesight, I join Openclassrooms to train as a frontend developer
flightRadar.milestone6_desc: I create my micro-enterprise and become a freelancer
flightRadar.milestone8_desc: I reach 40 missions on Malt with a 5/5 rating, I create an EURL because my revenue outgrows the micro-enterprise status! üëè
flightRadar.milestone9_desc: 2024 came with declining health, a year-long professional break allowed me to turn this ordeal into a thing of the past
flightRadar.milestone10_desc: I resume my activity, and give my first talk at Human Talks!

experience.title: Experience
experience.theia: Fullstack developer with Symfony & Vue.js on a secure online assessment and examination platform.
experience.viseo: Hexagonal architecture for a React application in a banking environment. Technical documentation adopted as internal reference.
experience.tudigo: Hexagonal architecture and NX monorepo to modernize the website. Pair programming and code reviews.
experience.artelia: Complete refactoring of a React application, 10x performance improvement. Mentoring a junior developer towards freelancing.
experience.exa: POC in React and Tailwind for a decentralized chat using the Matrix protocol. Open source collaboration.
experience.eu4ua: Volunteer contribution: technical design of a React application for a humanitarian project.
experience.sigilium: Microsoft Outlook add-in with HTML signatures and Azure SSO authentication.
experience.scality: Node.js 10 ‚Üí 16 migration, replacing deprecated methods to improve performance.
experience.cidj: Maintenance and improvement of an AngularJS application, Linux server stability.
experience.algoan: Backend microservices and chatbot in Nest.js for a major banking group. Extended mission.
experience.nleurope: Complete redesign of the design and interfaces of a European influence website.

dimitri.title: About Dimitri
dimitri.p1: My name is Dimitri. I've been a fullstack developer since 2019, based in Grenoble, at the foot of the mountains.
dimitri.p2: My path isn't linear ‚Äî I'm proud of it, and my story reflects well the person and professional I am today.
dimitri.p3: Placed in child welfare services, I had to build my life brick by brick with resilience and tenacity.
dimitri.p4: In high school, I was learning PHP with Le Site du Z√©ro: I was certain I'd become a developer, and I couldn't wait! But when I flew to Tokyo in 2013, I discovered an even stronger passion for aviation. I had no diploma and an empty wallet, but I worked incredibly hard to become an airline pilot. Everything suggested it was beyond my reach, but I ignored all prejudices and barriers to bet on myself and my determination.
dimitri.p5: I spent four years preparing for an airline pilot license. I had to stop because of my eyesight. This experience confirmed my taste for stress management and high-stakes responsibility.
dimitri.p6: I pivoted to web development. Since then, I've completed over 40 freelance missions ‚Äî banking, startups, investment, humanitarian work. What I love: taking over an existing codebase, understanding why it's struggling, and getting it back on its feet. Refactoring, architecture, performance. Making code clearer for those who come after me.
dimitri.p7: I place great importance on knowledge sharing. Pair programming, code reviews and documentation are powerful tools for any project, and for any developer.
dimitri.p8: Outside of code: I'm learning Japanese and sign language, I care about animal welfare, and I love music.

cgv.title: Terms of Service
cgv.intro_content: These general terms of sale apply to all services provided by Dimitri Bourreau, freelance developer, hereinafter referred to as "the Provider." Acceptance of a quote constitutes acceptance of these terms. They govern web development services.
cgv.art1_content: Services include web development, website creation, and web applications (SaaS, corporate sites, e-commerce, web applications).
cgv.art2_content: Two billing methods: fixed price (based on validated quote, any modification requires an amendment) or daily rate (billed monthly based on actual hours). Prices are exclusive of taxes. The Client reimburses documented expenses (travel, meals, etc.).
cgv.art3_content: Fixed-price contracts: 30% deposit upon signing, balance upon delivery. Time-based contracts: monthly billing, payment within 15 days. Accepted payment method: bank transfer.
cgv.art4_content: The Client may manage hosting and tools independently. Alternatively, the Provider can manage them with separate billing for hosting, domain and tool costs.
cgv.art5_content: The Client must provide all necessary elements (texts, fonts, images) free of rights before development begins. The Provider disclaims any responsibility for spelling errors or copyright violations in provided content.
cgv.art6_content: New developments require separate quotes. Modifications involving excessive duration, significant scope changes, or source file processing require additional quotes.
cgv.art7_content: Fixed-price contracts specify timelines; Client-requested modifications extend timelines. Time-based projects have mutually agreed durations, adjustable with reasonable notice.
cgv.art8_content: The Client must provide necessary information, respond promptly to requests and validate deliverables. Delays in providing materials or approvals postpone delivery dates.
cgv.art9_content: Code updates are published to the Client's version control system or staging environment. Fixed-price contracts: 7 business days to report issues; silence constitutes acceptance. Time-based contracts: continuous validation per agreed process.
cgv.art10_content: The Provider maintains strict confidentiality regarding Client information during the contract and for 2 years after its end, except for publicly available information or prior knowledge.
cgv.art11_content: Usage and modification rights are transferred upon full payment (unless otherwise stated). The Provider transfers representation, usage, modification and translation rights while retaining moral and attribution rights. Rights valid worldwide for the duration of copyright.
cgv.art12_content: In accordance with the Commercial Code: late payments incur penalties at the legal interest rate √ó 3 plus ‚Ç¨40 fixed recovery compensation. Additional costs may be claimed with supporting documents. The Provider may engage collection services and suspend/cancel services without notice or refund.
cgv.art13_content: Non-compliance triggers a 15-day formal notice by registered mail. Non-compliance results in contract termination without compensation.
cgv.art14_content: Either party may terminate with 2 weeks written notice (email/mail). The Provider retains payments received; the Client may freely use delivered work per Article 11. Services during notice period are billed as agreed.
cgv.art15_content: Unforeseeable and external circumstances (natural disasters, network failures, transport blockages) suspend obligations until resolution. The affected party must notify within 5 business days; parties then agree on continuation terms.
cgv.art16_content: The Provider is subject to an obligation of means. Liability is limited to amounts received in the preceding 12 months. The Provider is not liable for indirect damages (data loss, lost profits, reputation damage). The Client is solely responsible for backups and production environments.
cgv.art17_content: Unless otherwise specified, the Provider may publicly display completed work indefinitely for portfolio purposes.
cgv.art18_content: The Provider may modify these terms without notice. Modifications do not apply to existing contracts without express agreement.
cgv.art19_content: The contract is governed by French law. Parties seek amicable resolution; unresolved disputes are brought before the competent court.
